pullRequest.title: Add codec section to the event bus guide
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR:

adds a section about the usage of codecs to the event bus / @ConsumeEvent guide
renames the guide to reactive-event-bus instead of reactive-messaging as reactive-messaging is something else

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Quarkus allows different beans to interact using asynchronous events, enforcing loose-coupling.
          
          
            
            Quarkus allows different beans to interact using asynchronous events, thus promoting loose-coupling.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3,11 +3,11 @@ This guide is maintained in the main Quarkus repository
 and pull requests should be submitted there:
 https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/tree/master/docs/src/main/asciidoc
 ////
-= Quarkus - Asynchronous messages between beans
+= Quarkus - Using the event bus
 
 include::./attributes.adoc[]
 
-Quarkus allows different beans to interact using asynchronous messages, enforcing loose-coupling.
+Quarkus allows different beans to interact using asynchronous events, enforcing loose-coupling.

commit.message: Add a section about codec to the @ConsumeEvent documentation

Rename the guide covering the event bus and @ConsumeEvent

The current name is misleading (reactive-messaging being something else).
Also, change the title to reflect the content better.

afterCommit.message:
Rename the guide covering the event bus and @ConsumeEvent

The current name is misleading (reactive-messaging being something else).
Also, change the title to reflect the content better.
